remarks.format: ## Remarks 值类型表示值介于-128 到 + 127 之间的整数。The value type represents integers with values ranging from negative 128 to positive 127. > [!IMPORTANT] > 类型不是符合 CLS。The type is not CLS-compliant. 符合 cls 的替代类型是。The CLS-compliant alternative type is . 可以改用替换一个值为正值，其范围从 0 到。 can be used instead to replace a positive value that ranges from zero to . 有关 CLS 遵从性的详细信息，请参阅[语言独立性和独立于语言的组件](~/docs/standard/language-independence-and-language-independent-components.md)。For more information about CLS compliance, see [Language Independence and Language-Independent Components](~/docs/standard/language-independence-and-language-independent-components.md). 提供用于比较此类型的实例，实例的值转换为其字符串表示形式中，以及将数字的字符串表示转换为此类型的实例方法。 provides methods to compare instances of this type, convert the value of an instance to its string representation, and convert the string representation of a number to an instance of this type. 有关格式规范代码如何控制的字符串表示形式的值类型的信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For information about how format specification codes control the string representation of value types, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法实现接口，并且执行效果略好于方法因为它不具有要转换`value`对对象的参数。This method implements the interface and performs slightly better than the method because it does not have to convert the `value` parameter to an object. 具体取决于您的编程语言，它可能会对代码其中的参数类型具有较少的位的方法 （为较窄） 比实例类型。Depending on your programming language, it might be possible to code a method where the parameter type has fewer bits (is narrower) than the instance type. 这可能是因为某些编程语言中执行的隐式的扩大转换，它表示具有任意数量的位的实例作为类型参数。This is possible because some programming languages perform an implicit widening conversion that represents the parameter as a type with as many bits as the instance. 例如，假设实例类型是和参数类型是。For example, suppose the instance type is and the parameter type is . Microsoft C# 编译器生成的指令来表示形式的参数值对象，然后生成比较的值的方法实例和参数表示形式。The Microsoft C# compiler generates instructions to represent the value of the parameter as an object, then generates a method that compares the values of the instance and the parameter representation. 咨询你的编程语言的文档，以确定其编译器对数值类型执行隐式的扩大转换。Consult your programming language's documentation to determine if its compiler performs implicit widening conversions on numeric types. ## Examples 下面的示例演示泛型和非泛型版本的多个值和引用类型的方法。The following example demonstrates generic and nongeneric versions of the method for several value and reference types. culture's currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 符号可以出现的开始处`s`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现在末尾`s`如果`style`包括标志。The sign can appear at the remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`参数包含一个数字的窗体：The `s` parameter contains a number of the form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `s`参数被解释使用样式。The `s` parameter is interpreted using the style. 除了字节值的十进制数字，允许仅前导空格和尾随空格带有前导符号。In addition to the byte value's decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading sign are allowed. 若要显式定义可出现在的区域性特定格式设置信息的样式元素`s`，使用方法。To explicitly define the style elements with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `s`, use the method. `provider`参数是实现其方法返回对象，提供区域性特定信息的格式`s`。The `provider` parameter is an implementation whose method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of `s`. 有三种方法使用`provider`参数来提供到分析操作的自定义格式设置信息：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply custom formatting information to the parse operation: - 你可以将传递的实际提供格式设置信息的对象。You can pass the actual object that provides formatting information. (其实现仅返回它自身。)(Its implementation of simply returns itself.) - 你可以将传递指定的格式设置将使用的区域性的对象。You can pass a object that specifies the culture whose formatting is to be used. 其属性提供格式设置信息。Its property provides formatting information. - 你可以将自定义传递实现。You can pass a custom implementation. 其方法必须实例化并返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method must instantiate and return the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、对象使用当前区域性的。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个自定义波形符 （~） 定义为负号的对象。The following example defines a custom object that defines the tilde (~) as the negative sign. 然后将分析大量使用此自定义的数值字符串对象以及表示固定区域性的对象。It then parses a number of numeric strings using this custom object as well as a object that represents the invariant culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks `style`参数定义中允许的样式元素 （如空白或正整数或负号符号）`s`分析操作成功的参数。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space or the positive or negative sign symbol) that are allowed in the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必须是中的位标志的组合枚举。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 根据值`style`、`s`参数可能包括以下元素：Depending on the value of `style`, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 如果`style`包括、`s`参数可能包括以下元素：If `style` includes , the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*][*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space. 空格可以出现的开始处`s`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现在末尾`s`如果`style`包括标志。White space can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|特定于区域性的货币符号。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字符串中的位置由当前区域性的属性。Its position in the string is defined by the property of the current culture. 当前区域性的货币符号可以出现在`s`如果`style`包括标志。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 符号可以出现的开始处`s`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现的末尾`s`如果`style`包括标志。The sign can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 可以在使用括号`s`以指示负值，如果`style`包括标志。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*|一系列从 0 到 9 的数字。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9.| |*.**.*|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 当前区域性的小数点符号可以出现在`s`如果`style`包括标志。The current culture's decimal point symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*|一个或多个出现的数字 0-9 如果`style`包括标志或如果它不为 0 的数字的一个或多个匹配项。One or more occurrences of the digit 0-9 if `style` includes the flag, or one or more occurrences of the digit 0 if it does not. 小数位数可以出现在`s`才`style`包括标志。Fractional digits can appear in `s` only if `style` includes the flag.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字符，指示该值表示指数 （科学型） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation. `s`参数可以表示指数记数法的数字，如果`style`包括标志。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*exponential_digits**exponential_digits*|一系列从 0 到 9 的数字。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. `s`参数可以表示指数记数法的数字，如果`style`包括标志。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*hexdigits**hexdigits*|一系列从 0 到 f 或从 0 到 F.的十六进制数字A sequence of hexadecimal digits from 0 through f, or 0 through F.| 仅为十进制数字的字符串 (它对应于样式) 总是可以分析成功。A string with decimal digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully. 其余的大多数成员控件可能会存在，但不是要求必须存在，此输入字符串中的元素。Most of the remaining members control elements that may be present, but are not required to be present, in this input string. 下表指示个别成员影响中可能存在的元素`s`。The following table indicates how individual members affect the elements that may be present in `s`. |非复合`NumberStyles`值Non-composite `NumberStyles` values|元素允许在`s`除数字之外Elements permitted in `s` in addition to digits| |------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------| ||仅为十进制数字。Decimal digits only.| ||小数点 (*。*) 和*fractional_digits*元素。The decimal point (*.*) and *fractional_digits* elements. 但是，如果样式不包括标志， *fractional_digits*必须包含仅一个或多个数字 0; 否则为引发。However, if style does not include the flag, *fractional_digits* must consist of only one or more 0 digits; otherwise, an is thrown.| ||"E"或"E"字符，它指示指数记数法，连同*exponential_digits*。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates exponential notation, along with *exponential_digits*.| ||*Ws*开头的元素`s`。The *ws* element at the beginning of `s`.| ||*Ws*结尾的元素`s`。The *ws* element at the end of `s`.| ||前的一个正号*数字*。A positive sign before *digits*.| ||后的一个正号*数字*。A positive sign after *digits*.| ||之前和之后的括号*数字*以指示负值。Parentheses before and after *digits* to indicate a negative value.| ||组分隔符 (*，*) 元素。The group separator (*,*) element. 虽然组分隔符可以出现在`s`，前面必须是仅一个或多个数字 0。Although the group separator can appear in `s`, it must be preceded by only one or more 0 digits.| ||货币 (*$*) 元素。The currency (*$*) element.| 如果使用标志，`s`必须是十六进制值。If the flag is used, `s` must be a hexadecimal value. 有效的十六进制数字是否为 0-9、 a-f 和 A 到 f。Valid hexadecimal digits are 0-9, a-f, and A-F. 仅其他标志，可以与它组合为和。The only other flags that can be combined with it are and . (枚举包含复合数字样式， ，其中包含两个空白标志。)(The enumeration includes a composite number style, , that includes both white-space flags.) > [!NOTE] > 如果`s`参数的值的字符串表示形式的十六进制数，则无法前面添加的任何修饰符 (如`0x`或`&h`) 用于将其识别为十六进制数。If the `s` parameter is the string representation of a hexadecimal number, it cannot be preceded by any decoration (such as `0x` or `&h`) that differentiates it as a hexadecimal number. 这将导致分析操作引发异常。This causes the parse operation to throw an exception. 如果`s`表示十六进制数字，方法将解释为符号位的字节的高顺序位。If `s` represents a hexadecimal number, the method interprets the high-order bit of the byte as a sign bit. `provider`参数是实现其方法返回对象，提供区域性特定信息的格式`s`。The `provider` parameter is an implementation whose method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of `s`. 有三种方法使用`provider`参数来提供到分析操作的自定义格式设置信息：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply custom formatting information to the parse operation: - 你可以将传递的实际提供格式设置信息的对象。You can pass the actual object that provides formatting information. (其实现仅返回它自身。)(Its implementation of simply returns itself.) - 你可以将传递指定的格式设置将使用的区域性的对象。You can pass a object that specifies the culture whose formatting is to be used. 其属性提供格式设置信息。Its property provides formatting information. - 你可以将自定义传递实现。You can pass a custom implementation. 其方法必须实例化并返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method must instantiate and return the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、对象使用当前区域性的。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法将转换到的数字的各种字符串表示形式之间有符号整数值。The following example illustrates the use of the method to convert various string representations of numbers to signed integer values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式默认值 （"G"或常规） 中的值的当前区域性的格式。The method formats an value in the default ("G", or general) format of the current culture. 如果你想要指定其他文件格式或区域性，使用的其他重载方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| 返回值的格式使用的通用数值格式说明符 ("G") 的字符串表示值包括一个负号，如果其值为负数，且一系列的范围从 0 到 9，不带前导零的数字。The return value is formatted using the general numeric format specifier ("G") The string representation of the value includes a negative sign if its value is negative, and a sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9 without leading zeros. 负号由为当前区域性的对象。The negative sign is defined by the object for the current culture. 若要定义有符号的字节值的字符串表示形式的格式设置，请调用方法。To define the formatting of the signed byte value's string representation, call the method. ## Examples 下面的示例显示值使用默认方法。The following example displays an value using the default method. 它还显示的字符串表示形式通过使用数量的标准格式说明符得到的值。It also displays the string representations of the value that results from using a number of standard format specifiers. 示例使用 EN-US 区域性的格式设置约定来显示。The examples are displayed using the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式默认值 （"G"或常规） 中的值指定区域性的格式。The method formats an value in the default ("G", or general) format of a specified culture. 如果你想要指定不同的格式或当前区域性，使用的其他重载方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or the current culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| `provider`参数是实现。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法返回提供此方法返回的字符串的格式的区域性特定信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of the string returned by this method. 如果`provider`是`null`、值的格式使用当前区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the value is formatted using the object of the current culture. 唯一属性控制的字符串表示形式的对象使用常规格式说明符的值是，它定义表示负号的字符。The only property of the object that controls the string representation of the value using the general format specifier is , which defines the character that represents the negative sign. `provider`参数可以是以下之一：The `provider` parameter can be one of the following: - A表示的区域性的提供格式设置信息的对象。A object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. - 提供格式设置信息的对象。The object that supplies formatting information. - 实现一个自定义对象。A custom object that implements . 其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns the object that supplies formatting information. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个自定义对象，并将分配"~"字符到其属性。The following example defines a custom object and assigns the "~" character to its property. 然后，该示例使用此自定义的对象以及要设置格式的一系列的固定区域性的对象值。The example then uses this custom object as well as the object of the invariant culture to format a series of values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式通过使用当前区域性的约定指定的格式的值。The method formats an value in a specified format by using the conventions of the current culture. 如果你想要使用默认值 （"G"或常规） 格式或指定不同的区域性，请使用其他重载的方法，如下所示：If you want to use the default ("G", or general) format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| `format`参数可以是任何有效的标准数字格式说明符或自定义数字格式说明符的任意组合。The `format` parameter can be any valid standard numeric format specifier, or any combination of custom numeric format specifiers. 如果`format`等同于或`null`，当前的返回值对象使用常规格式说明符 ("G") 进行格式化。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the general format specifier ("G"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，该方法将引发。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下的格式设置主题中的更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关.NET Framework 中的格式设置支持的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 返回字符串的格式由为当前区域性的对象。The format of the returned string is determined by the object for the current culture. 具体取决于`format`参数，此对象控制输出字符串中的负号、 组分隔符和小数点符号等符号。Depending on the `format` parameter, this object controls symbols such as the negative sign, the group separator, and the decimal point symbol in the output string. 若要提供区域性而非当前区域性的格式设置信息，请调用重载。To provide formatting information for cultures other than the current culture, call the overload. ## Examples 下面的示例初始化的数组值，并通过使用每个标准格式字符串和一些自定义格式字符串来显示它们。The following example initializes an array of values and displays them by using each standard format string and some custom format strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像是方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 此方法无需使用异常处理来测试是否如果`value`无效，无法成功分析。This method eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a if `value` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `s`参数应为以下形式的十进制数字的字符串表示：The `s` parameter should be the string representation of a decimal number in the following form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 有效的符号字符由和当前区域性的属性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的十进制数字的序列。A sequence of decimal digits ranging from 0 to 9.| > [!NOTE] > 指定的字符串`value`参数不能包含任何组分隔符或小数分隔符，并且它不能具有小数部分。The string specified by the `value` parameter cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `s`参数解释使用样式。The `s` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 十进制数字，除了允许仅前导空格和尾随空格带有前导符号。In addition to the decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading sign are allowed. 若要显式定义可出现在的区域性特定格式设置信息的样式元素`value`，调用方法。To explicitly define the style elements with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `value`, call the method. `s`通过使用中的格式设置信息分析参数为当前区域性的对象。The `s` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object for the current culture. 有关详细信息，请参阅。For more information, see . 此重载将解释中的所有位`value`为十进制数字的参数。This overload interprets all digits in the `value` parameter as decimal digits. 若要分析的字符串表示形式的十六进制数，请调用重载。To parse the string representation of a hexadecimal number, call the overload instead. ##
